required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 4-Part Study In Healthy Volunteers To Evaluate Safety And Tolerability Of The Test Medicine MEDI7219 and to See How it is Taken up by the Body When Given as Single and Multiple Doses
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of MEDI7219 in Healthy Subjects, Including Assessment of the Impact of Changes to the Formulation and Determination of Intravenous Pharmacokinetics

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 4-part study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and PK of MEDI7219 in healthy subjects. Parts A through C are the single-dose parts of the study. Part D is the multiple ascending dose (MAD) part of the study. The starting dose and formulation for Part D will be selected from data emerging from Parts A and B. Enrollment of approximately 106 subjects is anticipated.

detailed_description.textblock: MEDI7219 is being developed for the potential treatment of type 2 diabetes. The study is a first in human, single and multiple ascending dose study that will try to identify the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics (how the drug moves through the body) of MEDI7219. The study will also look at the impact of changes to the formulation as well as differences related to the route of administration. The study will consist of 4 parts involving approximately 106 healthy male and female subjects (and up to 80 additional subjects). In Part A, 6 cohorts of 10 subjects each (with an optional 2 cohorts) will be randomized to receive MEDI7219 or one of two placebos. Each cohort will receive a different formulation of the study drug. In part B a single cohort of 16 subjects (with an optional second cohort) will receive a different formulation of MEDI1729 per period in up to 5 periods. In Part C up to 12 subjects will be dosed with MEDI7219. In Part D, one cohort of 18 subjects (with an optional second cohort) will be randomized to receive MEDI7219 or placebo. Subjects will start on a dose based on data from previous parts and will receive ascending doses for 20 days

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Adverse Events as a measure of safety and tolerability of MEDI7219
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to last follow up visit (Parts A, C, and D Day 28 and Part B 28 days post last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs) and serious adverse events (TESAEs)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C); Part D pre-dose to Day 28/EOS visit
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for Cmax (maximum observed concentration)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C); Part D pre-dose to Day 28/EOS visit
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for Tmax (time to maximum observed concentration)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C); Part D pre-dose to Day 28/EOS visit
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for T1/2 (terminal half-life)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C); Part D pre-dose to Day 28/EOS visit
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for AUC (0-inf) [area under the curve (AUC) extrapolated to infinity]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C); Part D pre-dose to Day 28/EOS visit
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for AUC (0-last) [area under the curve (AUC) from time 0 to last measurable concentration]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C); Part D pre-dose to Day 28/EOS visit
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for (AUC 0-24) [area under the curve (AUC) from time 0 to 24 hours post dose]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for AUC%extrapolated [The percentage of AUC(0-inf) accounted for by extrapolation]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for Lambda-z [Slope of the regression line passing through the apparent elimination phase in a concentration vs time plot]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration for CL/F (apparent clearance)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose to 144 hours post-dose (Parts A, B, C); Part D pre-dose to Day 28/EOS visit
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration for Vz/F (volume of distribution)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose to 144 hours (Part B)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration for Frel (relative bioavailability)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose to 144 hours (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration for Vd (volume of distribution)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose to 144 hours (Part C)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration for F (absolute bioavailability)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose to Day 28/EOS visit (Part D)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for AUC (0-tau) [area under the curve (AUC) for a dosing interval]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -1 to Day 28/EOS Visit (Parts A, C, and D); Day -1 to 28 days post last dose of final period/EOS Visit (Part B)
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of Anti-drug antibody to MEDI7219

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose to 8 hours post dose Day 1 (Parts A and B); Pre-dose to 8 hours post dose on Days 1, 8, 16 (Part D)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for Cmax (maximum observed concentration)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose to 8 hours post dose Day 1 (Parts A and B); Pre-dose to 8 hours post dose on Days 1, 8, 16 (Part D)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for Tmax (time to maximum observed concentration)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose to 8 hours post dose Day 1 (Parts A and B); Pre-dose to 8 hours post dose on Days 1, 8, 16 (Part D)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for T1/2 (terminal half-life)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose to 8 hours post dose Day 1 (Parts A and B); Pre-dose to 8 hours post dose on Days 1, 8, 16 (Part D)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for AUC (0-inf) [area under the curve (AUC) extrapolated to infinity]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose to 8 hours post dose Day 1 (Parts A and B); Pre-dose to 8 hours post dose on Days 1, 8, 16 (Part D)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for AUC (0-last) [area under the curve (AUC) from time 0 to last measurable concentration]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose to 8 hours post dose Day 1 (Parts A and B); Pre-dose to 8 hours post dose on Days 1, 8, 16 (Part D)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be calculated from the plasma concentration versus time data for (AUC 0-24) [area under the curve (AUC) from time 0 to 8 hours post dose]

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers age 18-55 years
- BMI 18-32 kg/m2
- Females not of childbearing potential
- Able and willing to adhere to the protocol
- Must provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any concurrent condition that in the opinion of the investigator would interfere with the evaluation of the investigational product
- Abnormal lab values, physical exam, vital signs
- Positive drug or alcohol screen.
- Current enrollment in another clinical study or enrollment within the past 3 months
- Any clinically important illness, medical/surgical procedure, or trauma within 4 weeks prior to dosing
- Abnormal ECG
- Positive Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C or HIV test
- Positive Drug or Alcohol screen
- Current smokers or those who have smoked within the last 12 months
- Recent plasma or blood donation
